channel.title: Client saves username and password at login
channel.description: When I run the client it already has the username and password saved to login. I want to know how to disable this feature so I can release the client/make webclient for others to play on my server without that login and password saved there at the login screen.

item.title: Client saves username and password at login
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

if he got moparscape then he can do that

Read full topic

item.title: Client saves username and password at login
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

in the moparscape client it’s in one of the files where it’s saved as username = mopar and password = bob

Read full topic
item.source: Client saves username and password at login

item.title: Client saves username and password at login
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

i think it saves in the cache
in my cache it has a file named: saveuser.ini
go into a file that looks something like this ^
and then search the username and pass and then empty it
then make a package from the cache and upload it so it will be
empty when you first play your server

Read full topic
item.source: Client saves username and password at login

item.title: Client saves username and password at login
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

I don’t think it saves the username for every computer, just your ip.
Maybe give the client to one of your friends to test

Read full topic
